Title: VDM appears in court for allegedly cyberbullying Nollywood actresses
Summary: Social media commentator Martins Otse, popularly known as VeryDarkMan(VDM) appeared in court on Tuesday over an ongoing cyberbullying case . VDM was seen inside the courtroom standing beside his lawyer, Barrister Deji .

Title: Foundation hosts inaugural girl child summit in Lagos
Summary: The Adunni Save A Girl Foundation held its first Girl Child Summit in Lagos . The summit, themed ‘The Girl I Am, The Change I Lead’, convened students, adults and children . Foundation aims to equip young women with skills and confidence to assume leadership roles .

Title: FG partners UNESCO REF to empower 4.5m Nigerians through climate-smart agric
Summary: FG partners UNESCO REF to empower 4.5m Nigerians through climate-smart agric . The Federal Government, through the Office of the Senior Special Assistant to the President on Food Security (SSAP-FS), has announced a strategic partnership with the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation, Read and Earn Federation .

Title: ‘Govt alone can’t cater for less privileged’
Summary: Founder of Ssonic Gas Company Foundation, Dr Ifeoma Douglas, has called on well-meaning Nigerians to actively support and complement government efforts in addressing the needs of the less privileged . She made the remarks in a speech at the foundation's conference .

Title: Again, contractors protest at finance ministry over ₦500b unpaid contracts
Summary: Local contractors under the umbrella of the All Indigenous Contractors Association of Nigeria (AICAN) have again staged a peaceful protest at the entrances of the Federal Ministry of Finance . The protest is over alleged continued delays in payments for completed and commissioned projects .

Title: Ex-UK prince Andrew unlikely to get refund for moving house
Summary: Ex-UK prince Andrew unlikely to get refund for moving house . King Charles III announced in October that Andrew was being stripped of his titles . He will leave the 30-room Royal Lodge on the sprawling Windsor Estate west of London .

Title: Senate considers bill to establish nationwide toll-free number
Summary: The Nigerian Senate is considering a bill seeking to establish a uniform, toll-free national emergency number for citizens across the country . The proposed legislation is titled “A Bill for an Act to Establish the National Emergency Toll Service (NETS) to provide Uniform, Accessible and Rapid Emergency Response Response .

Title: STATE OF THE NATION: APC, FG trying to destroy PDP — Bode George
Summary: Ex-Deputy National Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, Chief Olabode George, accused the All Progressives Congress, APC, led Federal Government of trying to destroy PDP . George said the APC and the Federal Government are trying to 'destroy' the party . The former deputy national chairman of the P

Title: Edo PDP urges Tinubu’s intervention in Okpebholo-Obaseki face-off
Summary: Osa-Ogbegie said the APC-led government was waging a “coordinated and increasingly reckless campaign” against former Gov. Godwin Obaseki .

Title: Wike, Fayose, 9 others get PDP expulsion certificates
Summary: People's Democratic Party (PDP) formally dispatched expulsion certificates to 11 prominent politicians . Former governors Nyesom Wike and Ayodele Fayose among those to get certificates . Party described move as decisive move to sanitise its ranks ahead of 2027 elections .

Title: Muslims, Christians victims of genocide in Nigeria — NIREC Sec
Summary: Executive Secretary of the Nigeria Inter-Religious Council, Prof. Cornelius Omonokhua, has said both Muslims and Christians are victims of what he described as genocide being carried out by bandits and terrorists across the country . He said the scale of killings in the country amounted to a “war on humanity,” noting that

Title: Tinubu, Abia gov meet in Aso Rock
Summary: President Bola Tinubu received Abia State Governor Alex Otti at the Presidential Villa, Abuja . The visit follows Otti’s recent trip to the Sokoto Correctional Centre, where he met with the convicted leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra, Nnamdi Kanu .

Title: Police ban sale, use of fireworks in Kogi
Summary: The Commissioner of Police in Kogi State, CP Naziru Kankarofi, has announced a total ban on the sale, distribution, and use of fireworks, knockouts, bangers, and all categories of pyrotechnics . The directive is aimed at preventing fire outbreaks, injuries, security breaches, and other avoidable incidents

Title: Stakeholders urge govts to boost funding for GBV prevention, response
Summary: Stakeholders on Tuesday called on the Federal and State Governments to budget more on GBV prevention and response . They made the call in Abuja during the launch of the 2025 Womanity Index report by Invictus Africa . They warned that inadequate funding is undermining Nigeria’s fight against GBV .

Title: CAC warns Nigerians against fake companies, lists unregistered firms
Summary: The Corporate Affairs Commission has warned Nigerians against dealing with individuals or organisations operating under certain company names and registration numbers that are not found in its official records . The unregistered companies include Famas Services Nigeria Limited, Promo Dutch Investment Limited, Dialack Concept Nig. Ltd, and Purpleheart Construction and Real Estate Mgt. Co.
